Variable Name: A unique identifier for the variable (column name) in the dataset.
Variable Label (optional): A brief user-friendly label or alternate name to clarify the variable’s meaning.
Description: A concise explanation of what the variable represents.
Data Type: Specifies the nature of the data (e.g., numeric; text; date/time; string; float, double; integer; ordered category; unordered category; etc.).
Units (if applicable): Indicates the measurement units (e.g.: meters; seconds; square centimeters) for numeric variables.
Missing Value Code: Defines how missing or undefined values are recorded (e.g.: NA = record not avaiable or -9999 = sample not taken).
Source: Specifies which file or dataset the variable is derived from.
